alert.note: Alert for Powell (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued November 27 at 4:29PM MST until November 27 at 4:45PM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM MST FOR SOUTH CENTRAL POWELL COUNTY... At 429 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located 9 miles west of Whitehall, or 11 miles southeast of Butte, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Flash freeze on roads. Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous and life-threatening travel conditions are expected to develop rapidly in the warning area. This includes Interstate 90 between mile markers 180 and 190. Locations impacted include... Deer Lodge. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads, bridges, and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. Slow down and be prepared for a sudden loss of traction. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents.
